questions.question: I didn't get ........................................ to finish the job.
questions.description: When enough modifies a noun it goes before the noun modified by it.

questions.question: His work was .......................................
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: He didn't run ................................... to catch the criminal.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: He didn't work .................................... to pass the test.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: He is ..................................... to take care of a pet.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: She is not ..................................... to marry.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: The weather wasn't ..................................... for a picnic.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: 1o. He is not .................................... to drive a car.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: He is not ........................................ to be a sprinter.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: You are not ...................................... to be a boxer.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.
